meanings.definition: A stone or concrete marker set up on a highway or at the side of a road to indicate the distance in miles from a given point.
meanings.sent1: The old mileposts along the road helped travelers track their journey.
meanings.sent2: The mileposts on the highway showed the distance to the next town.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids painted funny faces on the mileposts for a prank.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the mileposts symbolized the passage of time and memories.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting behind the mileposts created a picturesque scene.

meanings.definition: A significant point or event in the progress or development of something.
meanings.sent1: Graduating from college was a major milepost in her life.
meanings.sent2: The discovery of penicillin was a crucial milepost in medical history.
meanings.sent3: Reaching the top of the mountain was a thrilling milepost for the hikers.
meanings.sent4: The invention of the wheel was a revolutionary milepost in human civilization.
meanings.sent5: Winning the championship was a memorable milepost for the team.
